content.raw:
> I think using std::set or std::unordered_set in place of the std::vectors in the API may make more sense, so that we can guarantee that we aren’t getting duplicate Entity or ComponentTypeIds

Good point, I'll use `unordered_set`.

> have masked versions of SetState so that we can mask out particular entities or component types that we want to update.

I thought a bit about this and came to the conclusion that if the caller of `SetState` would handle this when assembling the state message, the ECM's API itself would be simpler. But I don't feel too strongly about it.
